title: Chapter 7 means test. What is reasonable & can be included on line 32 -telecommunication services?
question: I want to know what is reasonable and what counts. Thank you. I will most likely hire someone to handle this but am using a simulator to crunch the numbers first.
answers:
What is reasonable is factually dependent.

If it is an individual with a basic cell phone plan, telephone plan, internet, cable, that is reasonable. However, if it is also used for business purposes then a higher amount may be warrranted based upon the business usage.

I have an office in Riverside CA if you want a consultation.

BW 877-497-0627

In MO, I separate the service into telephony & non-telephony: purely vocal communication is the basic ($45-60), the remainder is non-telephony.

Non-telephony needs will increase with the number of users & the needs of the user. Someone who is required to be available 24/7 for business will have a higher non-telephony bill, $250 would be reasonable for such a user.

Pagers, call waiting, caller ID, internet access and similar items but only if necessary for the health and welfare of you or your dependents or generation of income. It does NOT include basic phone or cellphone service already included in the standards on Line 20A, or business expenses already included in lines 4b or 5b (at least not according to the Office of the United States Trustee.
